message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV 

This paper is about improving language models using recurrent neural networks, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses Bayesian neural networks and variational inference, which are topics in machine learning and statistics, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. The use of recurrent neural networks also suggests cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions using embeddings, which are commonly used in computer vision, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a less likely but still possible sub-category.
